poem:
**Parade Interrupted**  

The joyous tide of red,  
caught in the machinery of chaos—  
a boy, fifteen, cradles his leg,  
blood mingling with asphalt echoes.  
Screams echo among the forgotten festivity,  
as running feet write a new story:  
laughter turned to lament  
on a day meant for victory.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Man arrested after people hit by car at Liverpool FC parade – latest updates 9.04pm BST Outside the police cordon, Sonny Singh, 40, said he saw an injured teenager and dozens of people run past him “crying and angry” shortly after the collision. “People were running, screaming … I saw a boy, probably about 15, holding his leg and bleeding. There were loads of people there,” he said, adding that he had heard the vehicle". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
